replies.body:
Get a support ticket in right away. Submit copies of the emails you've received, and be patient and respectful. This can take some time to resolve, but you should be able to demonstrate that your account was compromised outside of your control and that you weren't responsible for this behavior.

Edit: League's ticket page is weird sometimes. Try accessing it in Incognito mode, or in a different browser. There should be no reason why being banned would prevent you from submitting a ticket, so that's certainly not the problem.

My friend irl is submitting a ticket for me, I tried a different browser and it still failed to work, its just I know Im not some pro player being bronze 1 with an all time high of silver 1 but I enjoy the game and it helps me fight off my depression and anxiety. I've spent a lot of money on my account, I dont want to lose that to somebody else and Im freaking out because of my anxiety. Im just trying to stay calm until I know exactly what to do

You really need to figure out how to submit a ticket yourself. Your friend's ticket won't help you, especially since this is a matter of account theft. They're not going to give him personal information on you.

calm down, relax,inhale,exhale. make a fake smile, you are all good, I know what you are going through

1.  run an antivirus program - if you can't afford a paid one (do not use the free AVAST) Panda anti-virus is good, reliable and free.
2. change your password. If you can, do it from your friend's machine by logging into your account instead of theirs. That will sidestep any malware or keyloggers that may be on your machine
3. Get your IP address and have it ready to submit with the ticket
4. when replying to support stay respectful, do not flame them at all.

Do steps 1 and 2 immediately

Also, and I don't mean to add to the finger wagging you are likely feeling like you are getting but I can't stress enough how important it is that your email password is totally unique. Think of your email address and associated password as the master key to your digital house.  Being able to log into your email with a compromised password will allow bad actors to change passwords to many other things - including your email account itself.

A good way to generate a password is to take the first letters of a quote that you can easily remember and then add the numbers and punctuation marks at the ends to bring it to 8-10 characters.

For example: With great power comes great responsibility. Uncle Ben.
Becomes something like:        7WgPcGr!UB 
Easy for you to remember.

Good luck
